definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to plan a project/to stand on tiptoe/Taiwan pr. [qi4]/abbr. for 企業|企业[qi3 ye4]
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: State-owned enterprises are the pillar of the national economy.
sentences.chinese: 国有企业是我国国民经济的支柱。

sentences.english: Stock company is the form of realization of state-owned enterprises at the operational level.
sentences.chinese: 股份制企业是国有企业在经营层次上的实现形式。

sentences.english: For one thing ， urgent measures are required to resolve problems involving state-owned enterprises .
sentences.chinese: 一方面，需要紧要方法解决涉及国有企业的问题。

sentences.english: The final solution should be the deepening reform and improved efficiency of the state-owned enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 国有企业的深化及效率的提高才是本。

sentences.english: Her husband works in the human resources department of a state-owned enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 而她的丈夫则供职于一家国有企业的人力资源部门。

sentences.english: The system-changing of state-owned enterprises has offered a severe challenge to the workers congress system in the enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 国有企业改制对企业职代会制度提出了严峻的挑战。

sentences.english: We will conduct pilot projects for reforming some collectively owned factories operated by state-owned enterprises and cities.
sentences.chinese: 做好部分城市和国有企业厂办大集体改革试点工作。

sentences.english: State-owned companies release only a small fraction of their shares to the market.
sentences.chinese: 国有企业只在市场上投放了一小部分他们的股份。

sentences.english: The heads of some of China's most vital state-owned companies, including oil giant CNOOC, also studied abroad.
sentences.chinese: 中国一些最重要的国有企业的负责人也曾在海外学习。

sentences.english: Through the mechanism of state-owned enterprises reform, gradually reducing losses for the win.
sentences.chinese: 通过对国有企业机制的改革，逐步走向扭亏为赢。

sentences.english: Sounds like something our own corporate-¬owned government would do.
sentences.chinese: 看起来只有我们的国有企业政府才会这样做。

sentences.english: The property right of the state-owned enterprise is the key problem of corporatization reform.
sentences.chinese: 国有企业产权问题是国有企业公司制改革的核心。

sentences.english: The property right of the state-owned enterprise is the key problem of corporatization reform.
sentences.chinese: 国有企业产权问题是国有企业公司制改革的核心。

sentences.english: The targets set for the reform of State-owned enterprises and lifting those enterprises out of difficulty have been met.
sentences.chinese: 国有企业改革与脱困目标基本实现。

sentences.english: SOEs, they don’t like us to grab their captains.
sentences.chinese: 国有企业，他们不愿意我们管理他们的机长。

sentences.english: China will actively attract foreign investment in reorganizing and transforming SOEs.
sentences.chinese: 中国将积极吸收外资参与国有企业改组改造。

definition: state enterprise/(Tw) abbr. for 國際企業管理|国际企业管理, international business management (as a subject of study)
private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]
centrally-managed state-owned enterprise (PRC), abbr. for 中央企業|中央企业[zhong1 yang1 qi3 ye4]
see 國務院國有資產監督管理委員會|国务院国有资产监督管理委员会[Guo2 wu4 yuan4 Guo2 you3 Zi1 chan3 Jian1 du1 Guan3 li3 Wei3 yuan2 hui4]
ownership of the means of production (in Marxism)/system of ownership
abbr. for 外商獨資企業|外商独资企业[wai4 shang1 du2 zi1 qi3 ye4]
privately run (i.e. by a company, not the state)
